channel.title: CSK Compatible
channel.description: Okay, I've tried so much, asked here and there even on RuneLocus, how do I make my server CSK compatible. I've tried the thread by Tico, but that only makes it Silabsoft compatible. I want to edit the CSK client and make it my server's client. How do I make my server CSK compatible?

item.title: CSK Compatible
item.dc:creator: @Call_of_Duty Call of Duty
item.description:
@Call_of_Duty wrote:

[quote=“delta, post:7, topic:179099”]Why didn’t it work? Getting errors or in-game problems?[/quote]Nothing spawns, don’t even get a message saying use as ::pickup or whatever. I DID have an error in my compiler, you added an extra bracket at the end. My source isn’t new, it’s Cheezscape, no Devolution or Dodian or whatever.

Read full topic

@delta wrote:

Why didn’t it work? Getting errors or in-game problems?

Read full topic

item.title: CSK Compatible
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Yeah you don’t need to add the item4.java part in tico’s tutorial.

And for the pickup maybe replace it with devolutions pickup. This pickup allows you to type any numbers without the 0 in front for example
::pickup 995 1
::pickup 95 1
::pickup 9 1
::pickup 10000 1

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } }

Read full topic

item.title: CSK Compatible
item.dc:creator: @Call_of_Duty Call of Duty
item.description:
@Call_of_Duty wrote:

[quote=“delta, post:2, topic:179099”]Do the same thing with Silabsoft compatible tutorial. They aren’t different except different clients so it wouldn’t really matter.[/quote]But whenever I do it, I can’t use ::pickup. Not just for items >30000 but for all items.

Read full topic
